sentence.Network_en: Commonly the dolomite crytals form a framework with evenly distributed porosity.

sentence.Network_en: Locally dolomite and anhydrite are important as cements.

sentence.Network_en: Many carbonate masses older than Middle Palaeozoic are of dolomite rather than calcite.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French, from the name of Dolomieu (1750–1801), the French geologist who discovered it, + -ite

means.word_mean: 1. a kind of sedimentary rock resembling limestone but consisting almost entirely of the mineral dolomite
2. a light colored mineral consisting of calcium magnesium carbonate; a source of magnesium; used as a ceramic and as fertilizer
